Tourny Log 1/2/3

POV: Kilians

Log Rating: 3.0000

here u go

Start logging: 14.05.2005 19:54
GT tick in 10
Zug flies north.
Epso flies north.
You follow Zug north.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Sharmaine flies in from the south.
Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state
must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled
this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road
leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.
701H 56V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> You tell your group 'tick in 10'
701H 56V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW>
Zug flies north.
Epso flies north.
You follow Zug north.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Sharmaine flies in from the south.
Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the
city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.
701H 55V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Epso utters some strange words.
Epso's skin begins to shine like steel.
701H 55V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW>
Zug flies north.
Epso flies north.
You follow Zug north.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Sharmaine flies in from the south.
Northern Road
The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an
eery silence, save for the noises that you make. This road runs
north-south, joining the cities fountain with the it's northern gate,
while
a narrow street leads east, towards the remains of an important looking
building.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Zug flies east.
Epso flies east.
You follow Zug east.
Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Sharmaine flies in from the west.
Before the Courthouse
The building to the south once served as the city hall and courthouse
for Tarsis. Even now, in its dilapidated state, the building still has
an
air of importance and authority. One of the main city roads lies to the
west, while the road leads eastward, towards the cities former markets.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.
701H 53V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Zug flies east.
Epso flies east.
You follow Zug east.
Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Sharmaine flies in from the west.
The Ruined Market
Broken stone tiles crunch under your feet; the massive stone tiles that
once endured the footfalls of men and horses alike lie shattered and
broken
here. The surrounding buildings are in the same condition: several have
missing walls and roofs while others have entirely collapsed onto
themselves.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.
701H 52V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW>
Zug flies south.
Epso flies south.
You follow Zug south.
Lashe flies in from the north.
Vittu flies in from the north.
Sharmaine flies in from the north.
A Shattered Road
The state of the road has long since fallen from its former grace. This
once busy, bustling market road has seen few travelers in recent times.
Skeletons of the buildings that once bordered the road are all that is
left, save the restaurant to the east that has somehow, miraculously
survived all this time.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
Sharmaine flies in from the west.
Pierre's Fine Tarsis Ham
Somehow, this restaurant has survived the devastation, destruction and
decay of time and remains as immaculate as the day it was last seen on
Krynn. The fragrant scent of ham still lingers in the air, making your
mouth water and your stomach growl. Some divine power has protected
this
place, and for reasons unknown to you, this place feels very important.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)

. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each
footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a
huge,
ominous crater.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)

Vittu flies in from the west.
Sharmaine flies in from the west.
East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Epso flies north.
You follow Zug north.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Sharmaine flies in from the south.
Wall Road
All that is left of the road to the north is a huge pile of rubble. The
outer city wall has fallen inward, blocking the path to the north. A
small
road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just
a
short distance south from here.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)

Zug flies west.

Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs
have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Epso flies west.

Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
Before the Bank
The broken road leading to the cities bank crunches and cracks beneath
your feet. Having survived the chaos and destruction that took this
city to
ruin, then withstanding the gradual decay of time has left this road in
a
dismal state of ruin. Small chips of stone and gravel crunch beneath
your
feet and the floor is cracked and broken in several places, leaving the
floor very uneven and difficult to traverse.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)

Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
Sharmaine flies in from the south.
Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city,
bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east
is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Zug flies west.
Epso flies west.
You follow Zug west.
Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this
area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and
common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands
as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been
torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Sharmaine flies in from the east.
A Fallen Guardpost
Remnants of the guard tower still sit atop the walls of the city here,
although not nearly enough to remain usable. Splinters of wood are all
that
remains of the supporting beams and the ladder that were once used to
gain
access to the tower.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)

Sharmaine flies in from the east.
The Northern Park Entrance
Twisted, crushed iron, painted in rust, is all that remains of the
fence and gate that used to separate the park from the city. The grass
that
once bordered the path into the park has been replaced by dust while
the
path itself has been broken by weeds.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)

Vittu flies in from the east.
Sharmaine flies in from the east.
Before the Library
Two large wooden double doors in the southern wall once opened to
scholars seeking the knowledge and wisdom that was housed within the
Great
Tarsis Library. Now only a single, beaten door remains, barely hanging
from
its rusted hinges, threatening to fall and shatter itself on the stone
floor. The wall to the north is a crumbling testament to the power of
time
and neglect: what was once relied upon to protect the city from
invaders is
little more than a mound of stones that a small child could surmount.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

Sharmaine flies in from the east.
The Back Alley
Even though the walls of the city are crumbling and large portions of
it are missing, this back-alley is still cast in shadows. Various thugs
once frequented this place, preying on hapless library-goers that had
lost
their way. The library itself rests to the south, a shattered, pathetic
shell of its former glory.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)

Lost Knowledge
Once, great scholars came to this library to scour over tomes
containing knowledge of the arcane arts, history, science, mathematics
and
countless other subjects. Now all of that is lost. Whatever was not
crushed, burned or otherwise destroyed has long since turned to dust.
The
countless shelves that were once lined with books are nowhere to be
seen
amidst the rubble.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)

Before the Library
Two large wooden double doors in the southern wall once opened to
scholars seeking the knowledge and wisdom that was housed within the
Great
Tarsis Library. Now only a single, beaten door remains, barely hanging
from
its rusted hinges, threatening to fall and shatter itself on the stone
floor. The wall to the north is a crumbling testament to the power of
time
and neglect: what was once relied upon to protect the city from
invaders is
little more than a mound of stones that a small child could surmount.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)

The Back Alley
Even though the walls of the city are crumbling and large portions of
it are missing, this back-alley is still cast in shadows. Various thugs
once frequented this place, preying on hapless library-goers that had
lost
their way. The library itself rests to the south, a shattered, pathetic
shell of its former glory.

North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this
area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and
common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands
as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been
torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)

Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city,
bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east
is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
scashells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes,
roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each
footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a
huge,
ominous crater.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the
city.

Western Road
This road runs east-west, from the Tarsis fountain towards the
wastelands. A small road leads north from here, past the old Tarsis
temple
and towards the park. Immediately to the south is a row of broken
buildings, most of them empty shells or heaps of rubble.

Near the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area.
Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches
off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
scashells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes,
roofs have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.

Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city,
bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east
is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the
wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn
cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing
stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of
what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of
their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.

A Path Through the Park
Whats left of the Tarsis park extends east and west from here, although
only a short distance to the west. The trees here have long-since died
away, only a few withering stumps remain as a reminder of the plant
life
that once flourished here.

Forgotten Park
The Tarsis park has fallen to ruin through years of neglect and decay.
Dry, withered stumps are all that remains of the majestic trees that
once
grew here. There is a very wide crack to the east, making it impossible
to
move further in that direction.

Forgotten Park

grow here. The trees that once filled this park are nearly all gone, in

strangely dead and desolate.

Forgotten Park

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced

city.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

474H 54V 13822X 1712C [Kilians:Fair] [Lashe:V.Good] Exits:NW> lEast
Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)

Eastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each
footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a
huge,
ominous crater.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the
city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)

Western Road
Large cracks in the stone tiles of the road indicate that the
foundation this road was set on has shifted and changed over time. This
road leads east to the cities fountain, and westwards towards the
Tarsis
wastelands.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the
city.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs
have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.

North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this
area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and
common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands
as
bas prominaan eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has
long been torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.

Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the
city.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs
have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.

Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the

leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this
area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and
common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands
as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been
torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.

Before the Library
Two large wooden double doors in the southern wall once opened to
scholars seeking the knowledge and wisdom that was housed within the
Great
Tarsis Library. Now only a single, beaten door remains, barely hanging
from
its rusted hinges, threatening to fall and shatter itself on the stone
floor. The wall to the north is a crumbling testament to the power of
time
and neglect: what was once relied upon to protect the city from
invaders is
little more than a mound of stones that a small child could surmount.

once bordered the path into the park has been replaced by dust while
the
path itself has been broken by weeds.

North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this
area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and
common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands
as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been
torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.

. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

Lashe flies in from the west.
Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city,
bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east
is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs
have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

Northern Road
The stone tiles of this road have long since lost their form and
structure: the road here is uneven and cracked, even missing in some
parts.
Broken stone and gravel speckle the road, causing each footfall to
create
an eery "crunching" sound. The main road runs north, towards the city
gates, and south, towards the fountain and city square. A smaller road
leads eastward towards the market.

The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an
eery silence, save for the noises that you make. This road runs

while
a narrow street leads east, towards the remains of an important looking
building.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the
city.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs
have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.

The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the
wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn
cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing
stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of
what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of
their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.

A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

624H 19V 13822X 1712C Exits:N> lA Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . has a metallic luster.
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.

The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These

that

rest

665H 55V 13822X 1712C Exits:N> lA Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.
Vespin, Deity of Idling is standing here. (red aura)
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)

(invisible)

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the
Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse
stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a
horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state
must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled
this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road
leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the
city.

Northern Road
The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an
eery silence, save for the noises that you make. This road runs
north-south, joining the cities fountain with the it's northern gate,
while
a narrow street leads east, towards the remains of an important looking
building.

Before the Courthouse
The building to the south once served as the city hall and courthouse
for Tarsis. Even now, in its dilapidated state, the building still has
an
air of importance and authority. One of the main city roads lies to the
west, while the road leads eastward, towards the cities former markets.

The Ruined Market
Broken stone tiles crunch under your feet; the massive stone tiles that
once endured the footfalls of men and horses alike lie shattered and
broken
here. The surrounding buildings are in the same condition: several have
missing walls and roofs while others have entirely collapsed onto
themselves.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs
have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.

Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city,
bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east
is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this
area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and
common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands
as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been
torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.

Before the Library
Two large wooden double doors in the southern wall once opened to
scholars seeking the knowledge and wisdom that was housed within the
Great
Tarsis Library. Now only a single, beaten door remains, barely hanging
from
its rusted hinges, threatening to fall and shatter itself on the stone
floor. The wall to the north is a crumbling testament to the power of
time
and neglect: what was once relied upon to protect the city from
invaders is
little more than a mound of stones that a small child could surmount.

Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city,
bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east
is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs
have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.

A Shattered Road
The state of the road has long since fallen from its former grace. This
once busy, bustling market road has seen few travelers in recent times.

survived all this time.

Pierre's Fine Tarsis Ham
Somehow, this restaurant has survived the devastation, destruction and
decay of time and remains as immaculate as the day it was last seen on
Krynn. The fragrant scent of ham still lingers in the air, making your
mouth water and your stomach growl. Some divine power has protected
this
place, and for reasons unknown to you, this place feels very important.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

Northern Road

structure: the road here is uneven and cracked, even missing in some
parts.

leads eastward towards the market.

North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this
area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and
common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands
as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been
torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.

665H 43V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> lNorth Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this
area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and
common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands
as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been
torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)

(invisible)

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse

have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a

A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the
wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn
cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing
stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of
what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of
their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the
south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever
might
have been in it.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the
city.

The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the
wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn
cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing
stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of
what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of
their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,

wastelands to the west.

A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the
Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse
stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a
horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state
must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled
this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road
leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

A Broken Road
Broken stone tile and long dead weeds litter this street. The buildings
bordering the street have all fallen to ruin: entire walls are missing,
roofs have collapsed. This city has fallen far from its former grace.

Before the Forge
Once, many warriors frequented this section of town. Between the
weapons shop to the south, the inn just a short distance to the west
and
the bar to the north, everything a young warrior needed could be found
here. Now, the only thing left of the building to the north is a pile
of
rubble and the shop to the south has long since been deserted.

Outside the Tarsis Inn
The Tarsis Inn, to the west, is one of the few buildings that remains
mostly intact. The sign that once hung above the inns door has nearly
fallen from its perch: it hangs by a single hook now, ready to fall and
shatter itself onto the cobblestone road.

The Tarsis Wastelands
The faint smell of decaying trash wafts in from the west on an unfelt
breeze. Although the city has long since been abandonned and deserted,
leaving the dump unused, the prominent smell of garbage will probably
linger here for some time still to come.

The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the
wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn
cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing
stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of
what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of
their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the
south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever
might
have been in it.

The Tarsis Wastelands
The smell of filth still lingers in the air here, a remnant of the
cities dump that rests just a short distance to the south. A short
distance
to the northeast, you can make out a wagon in this desert wasteland.
423H 75V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES> eThe Tarsis Wastelands
A small wagon rests just north of here, and although the paint has
faded, it still shows a myriad of color. This wagon once belonged to a
gypsy fortune teller, although there are no signs of any life around
here
anymore.
423H 73V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> wThe Tarsis Wastelands
The smell of filth still lingers in the air here, a remnant of the
cities dump that rests just a short distance to the south. A short
distance
to the northeast, you can make out a wagon in this desert wasteland.
423H 71V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES> sThe Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the
wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn
cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing
stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of
what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of
their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.

footstep, making it difficult to breath. There is almost nothing to see
in
this area, save the fallen city of Tarsis to the east.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the
south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever
might
have been in it.

481H 63V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW> eNear the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area.
Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches
off
to the south, leading towards the cities inn, while the main road leads
eastward, towards the city square.

head over heels.
The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the
south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever
might
have been in it.
A bronze dragon is sitting here.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the
south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever
might
have been in it.

464H 77V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> eOld Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the
city.
464H 76V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> eEastern Road
Weeds separated and broken through the stone tiles that once made up
this road, but even those weeds have long since died away. Each
footfall
echoes through the shattered, skeletal remains of the buildings to the
north. All that remains of the southeastern corner of the city is a
huge,
ominous crater.
464H 75V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> eEast Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
464H 74V 13822X 1712C Exits:NW> nWall Road
All that is left of the road to the north is a huge pile of rubble. The
outer city wall has fallen inward, blocking the path to the north. A
small
road leads west, into the marketplace, and the cities east gate is just
a
short distance south from here.

464H 71V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> nA Shattered Road
The state of the road has long since fallen from its former grace. This
once busy, bustling market road has seen few travelers in recent times.

464H 70V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES> nThe Ruined Market
Broken stone tiles crunch under your feet; the massive stone tiles that
once endured the footfalls of men and horses alike lie shattered and
broken
here. The surrounding buildings are in the same condition: several have
missing walls and roofs while others have entirely collapsed onto
themselves.
464H 69V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> nThe Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs
have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.
464H 68V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> nWall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city,
bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east
is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

464H 67V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW> North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this
area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and
common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands
as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been
torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
464H 66V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> nAlas, you cannot go that way...
464H 66V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> wA Fallen Guardpost
Remnants of the guard tower still sit atop the walls of the city here,
although not nearly enough to remain usable. Splinters of wood are all
that
remains of the supporting beams and the ladder that were once used to
gain
access to the tower.
464H 65V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW> wThe Northern Park Entrance
Twisted, crushed iron, painted in rust, is all that remains of the
fence and gate that used to separate the park from the city. The grass
that
once bordered the path into the park has been replaced by dust while
the
path itself has been broken by weeds.
464H 64V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> sA Path Through the Park
Whats left of the Tarsis park extends east and west from here, although
only a short distance to the west. The trees here have long-since died
away, only a few withering stumps remain as a reminder of the plant
life
that once flourished here.
464H 62V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> wOverlooking the Cratered Park
This narrow ledge overlooks the huge crater that has replaced nearly
the entire western half of the park. The soil is still charred and
burned
and you see no signs of life at all within the crater. The only exit
from
this ledge is back east, towards the remainder of the park.

369H 67V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> eAlas, you cannot go that way...
369H 67V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> sA Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the
Tarsis
wastelands to the west.
369H 66V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> sA Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

269H 60V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

aura)

A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the
wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn
cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing
stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of
what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of
their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)

Northern Road
The city square lies just to the south, where the sounds of children
laughing and other familiar city sounds filled the air. Now there is an

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the
city.
Fernar, Myth with a Big Shield and a Hacky is sitting here.

395H 71V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> wWithin the Broken Temple
This large, now-empty chamber once served as the entryway into the
Tarsis temple. The floor, once a polished, shiny marble, is dull and
cracked, having lost it's sheen long ago. There is a chamber to the
north

215H 44V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the
wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn
cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing
stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of
what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of
their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)

The Tarsis Wastelands

remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the
south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever
might
have been in it.

233H 54V 13822X 1712C Exits:NEW> l
Sharmaine flies east.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs
have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.

aura)

your
feet and the floor is cracked and broken in several places, leaving the
floor very uneven and difficult to traverse.

Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city,
bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east
is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
233H 34V 13822X 1712C Exits:SW>
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Sharmaine west.
North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this
area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and
common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands
as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been
torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
233H 33V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Sharmaine west.
A Fallen Guardpost
Remnants of the guard tower still sit atop the walls of the city here,
although not nearly enough to remain usable. Splinters of wood are all
that
remains of the supporting beams and the ladder that were once used to
gain
access to the tower.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
233H 32V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW>
Sharmaine flies west.

The Northern Park Entrance
Twisted, crushed iron, painted in rust, is all that remains of the
fence and gate that used to separate the park from the city. The grass
that
once bordered the path into the park has been replaced by dust while
the
path itself has been broken by weeds.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
233H 31V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW>
Sharmaine flies west.
You follow Sharmaine west.
Before the Library
Two large wooden double doors in the southern wall once opened to
scholars seeking the knowledge and wisdom that was housed within the
Great
Tarsis Library. Now only a single, beaten door remains, barely hanging
from
its rusted hinges, threatening to fall and shatter itself on the stone
floor. The wall to the north is a crumbling testament to the power of
time
and neglect: what was once relied upon to protect the city from
invaders is
little more than a mound of stones that a small child could surmount.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)

You follow Sharmaine west.
The Back Alley
Even though the walls of the city are crumbling and large portions of
it are missing, this back-alley is still cast in shadows. Various thugs
once frequented this place, preying on hapless library-goers that had
lost
their way. The library itself rests to the south, a shattered, pathetic
shell of its former glory.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse
stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a
horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the
Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

The Tarsis Wastelands
The faint smell of decaying trash wafts in from the west on an unfelt
breeze. Although the city has long since been abandonned and deserted,
leaving the dump unused, the prominent smell of garbage will probably
linger here for some time still to come.

The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the
wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn
cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing
stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of
what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of
their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.

would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing

There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of
what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of
their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.

The Tarsis Wastelands
The faint smell of decaying trash wafts in from the west on an unfelt
breeze. Although the city has long since been abandonned and deserted,
leaving the dump unused, the prominent smell of garbage will probably
linger here for some time still to come.

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse
stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a
horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

550H 84V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Epso Stormhammer, the Passion of Mishakal is standing here. (flying)
. . . is outlined with a dim aura.
Sharmaine De'Goss, The Utterly Useless is standing here. (flying) (red
aura)
Zug Zug is standing here. (flying)
. . . is followed by a hovering ball of light.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)

Epso flies in from the south.
Lashe flies in from the south.
Vittu flies in from the south.
A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the
Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse
stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a
horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

568H 85V 13822X 1712C Exits:N> lA Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the
Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

Near the Tarsis Wastelands
Dry dust stirs into small clouds with every step you take. The road
here appears to be unfinished, the stone tiles give way to dirt and
sand as
it approaches the wastelands. There air here is dry, and there is an
unnerving stillness here.

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse
stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a
horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state
must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled
this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road
leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the
city.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs
have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.

Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city,
bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east
is
bas kogiblocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are
a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this
area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and
common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands
as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been
torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is standing here. (flying)
(invisible)
Lady Lashe, Malevolent Priestess of Sedition is standing here. (flying)

North Gate
The northern gate of Tarsis once stood as an inpenetrable boundary to
would-be attackers from the Plains of Dust. Guards would patrol this
area
and often and protected the cities inhabitants from the nomads and
common
criminals that dwelled within the Plains. Now the shattered gate stands
as
an eternal testament to their failure: the gate itself has long been
torn
out of its frame and shattered onto the stone road of the city.

Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city,
bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east
is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs
have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.

A Shattered Road
The state of the road has long since fallen from its former grace. This
once busy, bustling market road has seen few travelers in recent times.

left, save the restaurant to the east that has somehow, miraculously
survived all this time.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

Old Tarsis Square

fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the
city.

The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the
wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn
cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing
stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of
what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of
their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the
south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever
might
have been in it.
