Near the Tarsis Wastelands
The broken road continues westward, towards the Tarsis Wastelands which
was once known for the vagrants and criminals that occupied the area.
Now
it, like the rest of the city, is barren and desolate. A road branches
off

eastward, towards the city square.

Old Tarsis Square
Dead, dry moss fills the cracks near the remains of the old Tarsis
fountain. The ruined fountain has long since dried up and is a broken
shell
of its former glory. The stone tiles that made up this square are
shattered
and broken; weeds have broken through some of the tiles and misplaced
others, but even those are long-since dead, much like the rest of the
city.

East Gate
All that remains of this once great gate are splinters of wood and
broken stone. Portions of the archway that once framed the gate have
collapsed and there are gaping holes in the thick city walls. These
gates
once repelled swarms of attackers, but the slow decay of time has
broken it
down. The path that once lead to the southeastern portion of town ends
in a
sudden drop-off; only a gaping crater remains where the buildings once
stood tall.

The Ruined Market
Large, burned out craters speckle the marketplace here serving as an
indication as to what happened to this mighty city. It is likely this
area
was heavily targetted when the city was attacked because of the dense
population of a crowded marketplace. The surrounding buildings are
hollowed
shells of their former glory: walls are filled with large holes, roofs
have
collapsed into several of the buildings, entryways have filled with
rubble.

Wall Road
Once there was an immense lookout tower at the northeast corner of
Tarsis that provided city guards with a vantage point to survey the
surrounding landscape. That tower collapsed inward, into the city,
bringing
a large section of the city wall with it. The entire road leading east
is
blocked by the fallen stone and rubble now, the only exits are a road
leading south into the market, and west towards the northern gate.

A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the
Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse
stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a
horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

A Shattered Gate
The southern gates of Tarsis were once heavily fortified, reinforced
steel, unlike their wooden counterparts at the north and east gates.
These
gates were made specifically to keep something out, and to make sure
that
it stayed out, especially since Icewall was to the south of this city
before the Gods took it away. The heavy fortifications and magical
enchantments on this gate are probably the only reason the gates still
rest
on their massive hinges, although those hinges have long since rusted
solid.

Southern Road
A massive, charred crater is all that remains of the southeastern part
of the city. Whatever struck this city and left it in its ruined state
must
have rivaled the destructive force of the Cataclysm to have levelled
this
large a section of the city. Despite it's poor condition, the road
leading
west is in much better condition than the road that once lead eastward.

Broken stone tile and long dead weeds litter this street. The buildings
bordering the street have all fallen to ruin: entire walls are missing,
roofs have collapsed. This city has fallen far from its former grace.

Before the Forge
Once, many warriors frequented this section of town. Between the
weapons shop to the south, the inn just a short distance to the west
and
the bar to the north, everything a young warrior needed could be found
here. Now, the only thing left of the building to the north is a pile
of
rubble and the shop to the south has long since been deserted.

Outside the Tarsis Inn
The Tarsis Inn, to the west, is one of the few buildings that remains
mostly intact. The sign that once hung above the inns door has nearly
fallen from its perch: it hangs by a single hook now, ready to fall and
shatter itself onto the cobblestone road.

The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the
wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn
cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing
stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of
what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of
their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.

Lashe flies in from the west.
Vittu flies in from the west.
A Crossroads
Once, the smell of the stables to the east filled the air with the
familiar odors of horses with just a hint of manure, now the air here
smells of stale dust. The South Gate of Tarsis lies just to the south,
while a smaller road runs from the stables to the east, towards the
Tarsis
wastelands to the west.

Forgotten Stables
The eastern half of this huge building has collapsed onto itself,
leaving half of the stables buried and unusable. Most of the horse
stalls
have been destroyed or fallen to ruin. This chamber has not seen a
horse
for several ages, but the smells normally associated with horses still
lingers here.

Lashe flies in from the east.
Vittu flies in from the east.
The Tarsis Dump
A forsaken desert surrounds you, swallows you whole with its forceful
gales that hurl grains of sand deep into your skin. It is as if the
wind is
penetrating your bones. Scattered pieces of brick and stone have been
discarded here in the dump. Where once a steady stream of horse-drawn
cart
would carry the refuse of tarsis to this forsaken landfill, nothing
stirs.
There is little here that is still useful, but the ancient bones of
what
you can assume were vagrants lie amidst the trash, with the hopes of
their
once peaceful lives covered with filth.

The Tarsis Wastelands
Once, these Wastelands served as a walking ground for muggers,
prostitutes, thieves and the like, but now it is dead and barren. The
remains of a large ship that was grounded here can be seen to the
south,
but it had collapsed onto itself a long time ago, destroying whatever
might
have been in it.

Near the Tarsis Wastelands

eastward, towards the city square.

The Reception
This is the reception of the lodge, where you would sign in for a
room. This is also a very popular place where adventurers sit around
and
share tales of their journeys. Some stairs in the back lead up to the
quarters.

wall.

665H 86V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> eVingaard Avenue South
This is Vingaard Avenue, a well traveled street that runs north-south
through Kalaman. To the north, you see the busy town square and bazaar.
Looking south, you see the poorer part of town, less frequented by the
general populace. The Traveler's Lodge is to the west and a fine diner
is
to the east.
A large pigeon is here pecking at some bread crumbs.
665H 85V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> nVingaard Avenue South
This is Vingaard Avenue, a well traveled street that runs north-south
through Kalaman. Just to the north, you see the busy city square and
Kalaman's own open air bazaar is to the east and west. Looking
southward,
you see the Traveler's Lodge, where most visitors to Kalaman stay.
665H 84V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> nMarket Square of Kalaman
This square is the busiest part of the city. People of all kinds walk
the city square of Kalaman. Shoppers, merchants and wagons go through
this
square non-stop all day long. The air is filled with the smell of food,
spice and anything else you can think of. It is almost impossible to
stretch your arms here without hitting something or someone.

665H 79V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> wwEntrance to Veterans Park
You are at the entrance to Kalaman's park. It was named Veteran's Park
to commemorate the fallen heroes of Kalaman's past. The park is the
place
where citizens come to take their time off and enjoy the tranquility
and
beauty the park offers. You can head west and enter the park or go east
onto Vingaard Avenue.
A solamnic knight is patrolling this area.
665H 78V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW> nVeterans Park
The park has many healthy trees growing alongside the small path you
are traveling on. It is very quiet and peaceful here; you listen to the
birds singing instead of the sounds of the marketplace in town.
The corpse of a little girl is lying here.
A cityguard of Kalaman looks about for signs of trouble.
665H 77V 13822X 1712C Exits:NES> wVeterans Park
The park is green, refreshing and quiet. This is a perfect place to
get away from the busy and noisy marketplace and come here to relax.
You
look around and see playful chipmunks scurrying about. You can hear
birds
singing. You could stay here and relax for a long time.
A large pigeon is here pecking at some bread crumbs.
665H 75V 13822X 1712C Exits:NSW> A Small Clearing in the Park
This is an open area in the park. All the small paths converge here in
front of the entrance to a small shrine. The shrine is dedicated to
nature
and the life it supports. There is a small archway leading into the
shrine.
A white marble fountain spring is in the middle of the clearing.

665H 87V 13822X 1712C Exits:N> nTraveler's Lodge
The lodge is famous for its hospitality and friendly service. The
lodge also has its own cafe, where they make great tasting coffee.
There is
also a lounge for the guests to rest and relax or do some reading. The
entrance is quite large and open; you get a feeling you will enjoy your
stay here already.
A Knight of Solamnia walks about the inn, keeping it safe.
665H 86V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> eVingaard Avenue South
This is Vingaard Avenue, a well traveled street that runs north-south
through Kalaman. To the north, you see the busy town square and bazaar.
Looking south, you see the poorer part of town, less frequented by the
general populace. The Traveler's Lodge is to the west and a fine diner
is
to the east.
A cityguard of Kalaman looks about for signs of trouble.
665H 85V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> nVingaard Avenue South
This is Vingaard Avenue, a well traveled street that runs north-south
through Kalaman. Just to the north, you see the busy city square and
Kalaman's own open air bazaar is to the east and west. Looking
southward,
you see the Traveler's Lodge, where most visitors to Kalaman stay.
A woman with a bag of groceries is making her way home.
665H 84V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> nMarket Square of Kalaman
This square is the busiest part of the city. People of all kinds walk
the city square of Kalaman. Shoppers, merchants and wagons go through
this
square non-stop all day long. The air is filled with the smell of food,
spice and anything else you can think of. It is almost impossible to
stretch your arms here without hitting something or someone.
A woman with a bag of groceries is making her way home.
A street cleaner is walking about, cleaning up the trash.

wood, reinforced with iron bars, and are very tough to break. The
gateway

case
of siege or attack.

676H 80V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> eA Large Building

freely

676H 79V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW> eA Gathering Room
This is a large room used for the students to recuperate and to tend
to their wounds, study their spells, and consort with other
adventurers.

occasionally
to look at a notice on the north wall. A doorway east leads outside to

676H 78V 13822X 1712C Exits:EWUD> uHall of Warriors
This is a long hall. You hear the clashing of metal echoing loudly
and muttered voices coming from all the rooms. The wall is covered in
sheets of paper with the recent Ranger, Paladin, and Warrior
promotions.
Amongst the promotions there are other lists of all the different
weapon
types that are used and taught to the warrior classes.

rooms are used for sparring, weapon proficiency, and general skill
practices. Primarily you see men dressed in worn silver suits of
platemail
and men carrying bows and arrows wearing suits of thick leather armor
heading westward.

People from all over Krynn come to this town for trade and other
business.
The town square is not too far to the west through the crowd. Some
other
notable sites are the Temple of Kalaman, which is to the northwest, and
Lord Calof's mansion; both are on the other side of Vingaard Avenue.

676H 61V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> wMarket Square of Kalaman
This square is the busiest part of the city. People of all kinds walk
the city square of Kalaman. Shoppers, merchants and wagons go through
this
square non-stop all day long. The air is filled with the smell of food,
spice and anything else you can think of. It is almost impossible to
stretch your arms here without hitting something or someone.
A woman with a bag of groceries is making her way home.
A street cleaner is walking about, cleaning up the trash.

676H 60V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> sVingaard Avenue South
This is Vingaard Avenue, a well traveled street that runs north-south
through Kalaman. Just to the north, you see the busy city square and
Kalaman's own open air bazaar is to the east and west. Looking
southward,
you see the Traveler's Lodge, where most visitors to Kalaman stay.
A woman with a bag of groceries is making her way home.
676H 59V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> sVingaard Avenue South
This is Vingaard Avenue, a well traveled street that runs north-south
through Kalaman. To the north, you see the busy town square and bazaar.
Looking south, you see the poorer part of town, less frequented by the
general populace. The Traveler's Lodge is to the west and a fine diner
is
to the east.
A senior ranking knight is here coordinating an exercise.
A cityguard of Kalaman looks about for signs of trouble.
676H 58V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> wsA Kalaman cityguard leaves south.
Traveler's Lodge
The lodge is famous for its hospitality and friendly service. The
lodge also has its own cafe, where they make great tasting coffee.
There is
also a lounge for the guests to rest and relax or do some reading. The
entrance is quite large and open; you get a feeling you will enjoy your
stay here already.
A Knight of Solamnia walks about the inn, keeping it safe.
676H 57V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> The Reception
This is the reception of the lodge, where you would sign in for a
room. This is also a very popular place where adventurers sit around
and
share tales of their journeys. Some stairs in the back lead up to the
quarters.

676H 46V 13822X 1712C Exits:NESW> Eastern City Gates
You are inside the eastern city gates. The gates are made of thick
wood, reinforced with iron bars, and are very tough to break. The
gateway
is arched, and above you you can see steel bars that can slide down in
case
of siege or attack.
A cityguard of Kalaman stands here, guarding the eastern gates.
A cityguard of Kalaman stands here, guarding the eastern gates.
A cityguard of Kalaman stands here, guarding the eastern gates.

676H 45V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW> Outside the Eastern Gates of Kalaman
You are outside the gates of the city of Kalaman. The large stone walls
rise high above you. From this vantage point you are able to see a few
Solamnic Knights walking about along the battlements overhead. The huge
city gates are directly west of you, and a small path leads off to the
east.
676H 44V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW> Beyond the Gates of Kalaman
You are just outside the eastern city gates of Kalaman. The path you
are traveling on turns south away from the city and cuts through the
plains
east of Kalaman. A large building made of old wood stands just off the
path
to your east, and you can hear loud noises of what you think is people
fighting within the building.
676H 42V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> eA Large Building
You see a large bulding made of old wood, yet it looks very sturdy. A
lot of noise can be heard coming from inside and shadows can be seen
through the windows of the upstairs rooms. Many people are roaming
freely
in and out of the front doors wearing different colored sashes. It is a
school of some sort. There is a sign on the wall.
676H 41V 13822X 1712C Exits:EW> eA Gathering Room
This is a large room used for the students to recuperate and to tend
to their wounds, study their spells, and consort with other
adventurers.
Many people are seen wandering up and down the stairs stopping
occasionally
to look at a notice on the north wall. A doorway east leads outside to
a
porch and you can smell food cooking.
676H 40V 13822X 1712C Exits:EWUD> uHall of Warriors
This is a long hall. You hear the clashing of metal echoing loudly
and muttered voices coming from all the rooms. The wall is covered in
sheets of paper with the recent Ranger, Paladin, and Warrior
promotions.
Amongst the promotions there are other lists of all the different
weapon
types that are used and taught to the warrior classes.
676H 39V 13822X 1712C Exits:EWD> wA Hall
The long hall continues to the practice rooms. All the different
rooms are used for sparring, weapon proficiency, and general skill
practices. Primarily you see men dressed in worn silver suits of
platemail
and men carrying bows and arrows wearing suits of thick leather armor
heading westward.
676H 38V 13822X 1712C Exits:ESW> sSparring Room
This is a sparring room. All the warrior classes are here practicing
their skills with one another. There is a pile of old worn down shields
and long swords in the corner destroyed from all the abuse.
A small wooden chest rests here.

quarters.

676H 87V 13822X 1712C Exits:N> lThe Reception
This is the reception of the lodge, where you would sign in for a
room. This is also a very popular place where adventurers sit around
and
share tales of their journeys. Some stairs in the back lead up to the
quarters.
A wooden bulletin board with the heading 'Wanted' is posted on the
wall.
A delicious loaf of bread rests upon the ground. [9]
A small steel key lies here.
A delicious loaf of bread rests upon the ground. [9]
Vittu N. Hullu, Crimson Maw Brothers of Doom is resting here. (flying)
(invisible)
You see the outline of a life form here, carrying: a glowing scroll of
recall; a glowing scroll of recall; a glowing scroll of recall.
You see the outline of a life form here, carrying: a silver banded
locket.
Daniel is resting here. (red aura)
The manager of Traveler's Lodge stands here ready to sign you in.

stands here.
